news_header: The UK's Labour Party will present its first budget in over 14 years on October 30, facing challenges from a sluggish economy and public service demands.
news_text: On October 30, the UK's Labour Party will unveil its first budget in more than 14 years, addressing a sluggish economy inherited from the Conservative Party. Chancellor Rachel Reeves has highlighted a significant public finance deficit. The government aims to balance tax promises and public investment needs, with potential tax increases of up to £35 billion expected. Despite criticism over austerity measures, Labour is focused on improving public services and investment, with hopes that increased spending will offset negative reactions to tax hikes.
